title: Spurious "out of memory" crash
body:
#### System information

```
% geth version  
Geth
Version: 1.4.3-stable
Protocol Versions: [63 62 61]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.5.1
OS: linux
GOPATH=/usr/lib/go/src/pkg
GOROOT=/usr/lib/go
```

OS & Version: Ubuntu

```
% uname -a
Linux tyrion 4.2.0-30-generic #36-Ubuntu SMP Fri Feb 26 00:57:19 UTC 2016 i686 i686 i686 GNU/Linux
```

Commit hash : Release
#### Expected behaviour

No problem
#### Actual behaviour

`geth --testnet` crashes with "out of memory" messages. When I relaunch it, it goes further then re-crashes. 

I don't trust the `out of memory` message. Just before the crash, the machine has enough memory:

```
% ps uxwww|grep geth
stephane 19428 79.1 14.6 1032960 591048 pts/18 DNl+ 12:32   7:20 geth -testnet

% free
             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:       4044172    3235792     808380      96524      57884    2713260
-/+ buffers/cache:     464648    3579524
Swap:      4097020    1094928    3002092

```
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

```
I0523 17:04:19.917130 core/blockchain.go:959] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 1 txs in 17.113637ms. #993686 [02b99f73 / 02b99f73]
```

And mining now works fine. So, workaround to this bug: restarts geth as often as necessary until your are synced.
